intro: Deprea vasquezii, commonly known as the Vásquez's daisy, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features small, white ray florets surrounding a central disk of yellow tubular flowers, typical of the family. It is adapted to survive in dry environments with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Deprea vasquezii is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
